CatDescriptText: Mrs. James A. Grimes, 822-1/2 Clarissa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "Definitely. There's no doubt about it.  Without the father being the real head of the family, there will be no accomplishments in rearing of the young.  The father is really the head of the house."
TitMainTitle: Mrs. James A. Grimes wearing dark flecked button down coat with collar, dark gloves, eyeglasses, and dark hat with beading, carrying handbag, standing on Wood Street in front of RAAB clothing store, with  Dimlings Candy store on Liberty Avenue in background
